channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2024030662
item.description:
Report X-2024030662

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DAMAGE IN SMALL SORT, RESTRICTED AREA. USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS, USED PPE (GOGGLES, GLOVES WITH LINER, BOOTS, APRON , SLEEVES) TEST SPILL WITH PH TAPE PH1, ADDED SODIUM BICARBONATE, PH7, ABSORBED SPILL WITH CLAY ABSORBENT, PLACED DAMAGED PACKAGE IN SPILL TUB. RETURNED TO DMP CAGE FOR PROPER PROCESSING, PROCESSED USING UPS DMP PROCEDURES

item.title: Report X-2024030652
item.description:
Report X-2024030652

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO EXPIRED HAZ-MAT DISCREPENCY PACKAGE. CONTENTS WAS 12-(1 QT) ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL ALCCOOL ANTISEPTIC. THE PACKAGE WAS MARKED WITH PROPER 5 PART FORM (SHIPPING PAPERS), PROPER DIAMOND LABEL FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3, PROPER UN INFORMATION 1219 ISOPROPANOL. THE PACKAGE WAS HELD BY AUDITOR, CONTENTS WAS SHIPPED IN A STANDARD BOX, NO BURST EDGE PROTECTION RATING, AND CORNERS WERE CRUSHED. THE 12- (1 QT) BOTTLES WERE ABSORBED WITH ZEP ZORBENT. THE OUTER CARTON WAS THROWN IN THE REGULAR TRASH.

item.title: Report E-2024030055
item.description:
Report E-2024030055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-3ft area of the concrete floor and estimated that two (2) pints of material was released due to puncture of one (1) 330- gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. The contractor transferred the remaining material into a new poly tote. The damaged poly tote and spent absorbents were containerized into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The new poly tote and generated drums of waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024030238
item.description:
Report X-2024030238

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found in the trailer wet and was put into a red tote. QA then took the hazmat to the hazmat cage where it was found to be that the lid of the internal bottle was loose and causing the spill. DescribePack: Lid of Hazmat was not properly tightened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as hazmat was located it was put in a hazmat leaker tote.
